Package ludo.square

Class CrossingSquare

  • java.lang.Object
    • ludo.square.NormalSquare
      • ludo.square.CrossingSquare
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ISquare

    public class CrossingSquare
extends NormalSquare
    CrossingSquare is the intersection between the outer main route and the couloirs in the middle. So if a token reaches the crossing square of its color, it is moved into its couloir in the middle of the field. So it is connected with the next square on the route and additionally with the couloir of its color. It knows -its color -the starting square of the respective couloir.

    • Method Detail

      • setCouloirEnter

        public void setCouloirEnter​(CouloirSquare couloir)
        Sets the first Square of the couloir. Should be the one from its player. This method is called at the initialization of the board to set the intersection.
        Specified by:
        setCouloirEnter in interface ISquare
        Overrides:
        setCouloirEnter in class NormalSquare
        Parameters:
        couloir - The first square of the couloir it has to intersect.

      • getNextSquare

        public ISquare getNextSquare​(Token token)
        Marks the crossing that moves Tokens into the couloir.
        Specified by:
        getNextSquare in interface ISquare
        Overrides:
        getNextSquare in class NormalSquare
        Parameters:
        token - The Token that asks the next square. Used to determine its way at the crossing square.
        Returns:
        Either the next square, if the token is not from its player Or the first CouloirSquare from the player the token belongs to that finds himself on this square.
